alert.note: Alert for Coffee; Dale; Geneva; Houston (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 6:12PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHERN DALE...SOUTHEASTERN COFFEE...NORTHEASTERN GENEVA AND NORTHWESTERN HOUSTON COUNTIES THROUGH 700 PM CDT... At 612 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Level Plains, or near Enterprise. The strong thunderstorm is nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph. SOURCE...KOZR reported a gust of 36mph at 6:04PM CT. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Daleville, Elba, Fort Novosel, Enterprise, Ozark, Dothan, Midland City, Level Plains, Newton, New Brockton, Pinckard, Clayhatchee, Napier Field, Coffee Springs, Hunt Field, Waterford, Hooper Stage Field, Gerald, Central City, and Clintonville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
